name: places/ChIJ178knFZYwokRg7QkWrbZWR4
adrFormatAddress: 780 8th Ave #300, New York, NY 10036, USA

originalText.text: Alana is amazing! I wouldn't be where I am post accident without her. I've seen several therapists before her but they didn't do half of what she did in a few sessions. The staff are great and the talent is high. They are right off Broadway/times Square so it's easy to get to.

text.text: Alana is amazing! I wouldn't be where I am post accident without her. I've seen several therapists before her but they didn't do half of what she did in a few sessions. The staff are great and the talent is high. They are right off Broadway/times Square so it's easy to get to.

originalText.text: Wonderful practice with a really kind and caring team of PTs who know what they are doing. I washed up here last fall in a post natal haze and a knee injury that made even climbing stairs a challenge. I was assigned Alaina, who listened closely to my issues and worked with me slowly and steadily to get me back to fitness. I owe her everything positive about my body now! Having eavesdropped on the other PTs with their patients, I am pretty sure that the others are equally awesome. The communal atmosphere with its large, airy and sunlit open space made such a difference, even in the depths of winter. Listening to the banter of the Broadway community made the experience extra special. This place feels like a special village where you go to heal in all sorts of ways - not with fancy equipment, but very sound medicine and a lot of heart. And a special shout out to Sherri, who just makes my day when I walk through the door by emanating good cheer (and an amazing scent from her aromatherapy diffuser). She is the expert on all things insurance and was kind enough to refer one of my friends who wasn't covered for Neurosport to a practice that would take her insurance. Your account is safe in her hands! Please keep going here, they are taking extreme precautions with covid and will keep you safe.

originalText.text: After being referred by my longtime Dr's I tried to get an appointment being an ex dancer but was told my insurance was not my primary...she insisted something that only I would know...would not call the verification number in Los Angeles. I said the hell with it, going to Harkness Center for Dance Injuries instead. I tire of young people who think they know more about you than you. I cannot really rate them because I never got to see them, perhaps the gods spared me more pain than my old feet.

originalText.text: Chris is very good and knowledgable and at his profession making for a great healing environment.
